attributes.action: Create a new "NHS Day" bank holiday in honour of our National Health Service
attributes.additional_details:
The UK has only eight national holidays a year, compared to other major economies:

France, Poland - 11
Italy - 12
Russia - 13
Spain, Portugal, Sweden, Turkey - 14
Japan, South Korea - 16
India - 18

UK bank holidays are also not officially "non-working", so employees are not entitled to higher rates of pay.

This can be easily rectified, and the NHS and its staff deserve the recognition of a national day of celebration.
attributes.background:
The bravery, care, and dedication of NHS staff is evident every single day, and should be celebrated every year, not just in times of crisis.
Create an annual, non-working holiday to recognise this and ensure that future generations celebrate the importance of a universal, free, publicly-owned NHS.
